item.title: On the distribution of the Fourier coefficients over two sparse sequences
item.description: arXiv:2509.07037v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Let $j\geq 3$ be any fixed integer and $f$ be a primitive holomorphic cusp form of even integral weight $\kappa\geq 2$ for the full modular group $SL(2,\mathbb{Z})$. We write $\lambda_{{\rm{sym}^j }f}(n)$ for the $n^\text{th}$ normalized Fourier coefficient of $L(s,{\rm{sym}}^j f)$. In this article, we establish asymptotic formulae for the discrete sums of the Fourier coefficients $\lambda_{{\rm{sym}}^j f}^2(n)$ over two sparse sequence of integers, which can be written as the sum of four integral squares and the sum of six integral squares, with refined error terms.
item.dc:creator: Venkatasubbareddy Kampamolla

item.title: Generalized Sato-Tate and quadratic residues
item.description: arXiv:2509.07183v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We show that the Generalized Sato-Tate Conjecture permits to obtain rather precise information on the distribution of the consecutive quadratic residues modulo large primes.
item.dc:creator: Sergey Vladuts

item.title: A Baseline $T\log^2 T$ Upper Bound for KL-Regularized Prime--Zero Optimal Transport
item.description: arXiv:2509.07329v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We prove that $\mathsf{OT}_\eta(T)\ll T\log^2 T$ unconditionally via a band-limited test scheme with Fej\'er averaging. The approach normalizes $\|\widehat f\|_1=\Theta(T^{-1})$ to ensure $\|h\|_1\asymp T$ and $\|\widehat h\|_1\ll 1$, and applies an $L^1$-controlled smoothed explicit formula to bound the error terms. As a result, the prime--zero optimal transport distance admits the baseline $T\log^2 T$ upper bound without additional assumptions.
item.dc:creator: Zhejun Yang (University of Sydney)

item.title: Nagell-Lutz theorem for imaginary quadratic fields of class number one
item.description: arXiv:2509.07524v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We prove the Nagell-Lutz theorem for the imaginary quadratic fields of class number one.
item.dc:creator: Leena Mondal, Amrutha C

item.title: Smoothed Shifted Convolutions of Generalised Divisor Functions
item.description: arXiv:2509.07556v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We prove an asymptotic formula for the smoothed shifted convolution of the generalised divisor function $d_k(n)$ and the divisor function $d(n)$, with a power-saving error term independent of $k$. In particular, when $k$ is large, this is an improvement on Topacogullari (2018).
item.dc:creator: Cheuk Fung Lau

item.title: Anticyclotomic diagonal classes and Beilinson--Flach elements
item.description: arXiv:2509.07564v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We present a comparison between the anticyclotomic Euler system of diagonal cycles associated with the convolution of two modular forms and the cyclotomic Beilinson--Flach Euler system. This extends the seminal work of Bertolini, Darmon, and Venerucci, who established a link between (anticyclotomic) Heegner points and the Beilinson--Kato system. Our approach hinges on a detailed analysis of $p$-adic $L$-functions and Perrin-Riou maps and exploits the Eisenstein degeneration of diagonal cycles along Hida families, working with a CM family which specializes to an irregular Eisenstein series in weight one. We use these results to derive some arithmetic applications.
item.dc:creator: Ra\'ul Alonso, Lois Omil-Pazos, \'Oscar Rivero

item.title: Large quadratic character sums
item.description: arXiv:2509.07651v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this article, we investigate conditional large values of quadratic Dirichlet character sums. We prove some Omega results of quadratic character sums under the assumption of the generalized Riemnn hypothesis, which are as sharp as previous results for all characters modulo a large prime.
item.dc:creator: Zikang Dong, Yanbin Zhang

item.title: Burgess-type character sum estimates over generalized arithmetic progressions of rank $2$
item.description: arXiv:2509.07765v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We extend the classical Burgess estimates to character sums over proper generalized arithmetic progressions (GAPs) of rank $2$ in prime fields $\mathbb{F}_p$. The core of our proof is a sharp upper bound for the multiplicative energy of these sets, established by adapting an argument of Konyagin and leveraging tools from the geometry of numbers. A key step in our argument involves establishing new upper bounds for the sizes of Bohr sets, which may be of independent interest.
item.dc:creator: Ali Alsetri, Xuancheng Shao

item.title: Complex moments of the derivative of the Riemann zeta function
item.description: arXiv:2509.07788v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We conjecture results about the complex moments of the derivative of the Riemann zeta function, evaluated at the non-trivial zeros of the Riemann zeta function. We do this via two different random matrix computations. In the first, we find an exact formula for the complex moments of the derivative of the characteristic polynomials of unitary matrices averaged over Haar measure using Selberg's integral. In the second, we consider the hybrid approach for zeta, first proposed by Gonek, Hughes and Keating.
item.dc:creator: Christopher Hughes, Andrew Pearce-Crump

item.title: Integer moments of the derivatives of the Riemann zeta function
item.description: arXiv:2509.07792v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We conjecture the full asymptotic expansion of a product of Riemann zeta functions, evaluated at the non-trivial zeros of the zeta function, with shifts added in each argument. By taking derivatives with respect to these shifts, we form a conjecture for the integer moments of mixed derivatives of the zeta function. This generalises a result of the authors where they took complex moments of the first derivative of the zeta function, evaluated at the non-trivial zeros. We approach this problem in two different ways: the first uses a random matrix theory approach, and the second by the Ratios Conjecture of Conrey, Farmer, and Zirnbauer.
item.dc:creator: Christopher Hughes, Andrew Pearce-Crump

item.title: On special values of generalized $p$-adic hypergeometric functions of logarithmic type
item.description: arXiv:2509.07895v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We introduce a new type of $p$-adic hypergeometric functions, which are generalizations of $p$-adic hypergeometric functions of logarithmic type defined by Asakura, and show that these functions satisfy the congruence relations similar to Asakura's. We also give numerical computations of the special values of these functions at $t=1$ and prove that these values are equal to zero under some conditions.
item.dc:creator: Yusuke Nemoto

item.title: On a pair of three-colored (mod 10) partition identities
item.description: arXiv:2509.07169v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We prove a pair of (mod 10) partition identities. The sum sides involve three-colored partitions into distinct parts, while the product sides are the generating functions for distinct partitions times the Rogers-Ramanujan products. Our proofs make heavy use of Maple to verify that functional equations are satisfied.
item.dc:creator: Matthew C. Russell

item.title: The Hasse principle for homogeneous polynomials with random coefficients over thin sets
item.description:
arXiv:2305.08035v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this paper, we investigate the solubility of homogeneous polynomial equations. The work of Browning, Le boudec, Sawin [3] shows that almost all homogeneous equations of degree $d\geq 4$ in $d+1$ or more variables satisfy the Hasse principle, and in particular that a positive portion possess a non-trivial integral solution. Our main result, when combined with our sequel joint work with H.Lee and S.Lee, shows that such a conclusion remains true even when the coefficients of homogeneous polynomials are constrained by a polynomial condition under a modest condition on the number of variables. To be precise, let $d$ and $n$ be natural numbers. Let $
u_{d,n}: \mathbb{R}^nightarrow \mathbb{R}^N$ denote the Veronese embedding with $N= inom{n+d-1}{d}$, defined by listing all the monomials of degree $d$ in $n$ variables using the lexicographical ordering. Let $\langle  oldsymbol{a}, 
u_{d,n}( oldsymbol{x})angle\in \mathbb{Z}[ oldsymbol{x}]$ be a homogeneous polynomial in $n$ variables of degree $d$ with integer coefficients $ oldsymbol{a}$, where $\langle\cdot,\cdotangle$ denotes the inner product. For a non-singular form $P\in \mathbb{Z}[ oldsymbol{x}]$ in $N$ variables of degree $k\geq 2,$ consider a set of integer vectors $ oldsymbol{a}\in \mathbb{Z}^N$, defined by $$\mathfrak{A}(A;P)=\{ oldsymbol{a}\in \mathbb{Z}^N|\ P( oldsymbol{a})=0,\ \| oldsymbol{a}\|_{\infty}\leq A\}.$$ We confirm that when $d\geq 4$, $n$ is sufficiently large in terms of $d$, and $k\leq d,$ the proportion of integer vectors $ oldsymbol{a}\in \mathbb{Z}^N$ in $\mathfrak{A}(A;P)$, whose associated equations $\langle  oldsymbol{a}, 
u_{d,n}( oldsymbol{x})angle=0$ satisfy the Hasse principle, converges to $1$ as $Aightarrow \infty$. We make explicit a lower bound on $n$ guaranteeing this conclusion. In particular, we show that when $d\geq 14$ it suffices to take $n\geq 32d+17$.
item.dc:creator: Kiseok Yeon

item.title: Transfer principles for Galois cohomology and Serre's conjecture II
item.description: arXiv:2308.00903v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this article, we prove several transfer principles for the cohomological dimension of fields. Given a fixed field $K$ with finite cohomological dimension $\delta$, the two main ones allow to: - construct totally ramified extensions of $K$ with cohomological dimension $\leq \delta - 1$ when $K$ is a complete discrete valuation field; - construct algebraic extensions of $K$ with cohomological dimension $\leq \delta-1$ and satisfying a norm condition. We then apply these results to Serre's conjecture II and to some variants for fields of any cohomological dimension that are inspired by conjectures of Kato and Kuzumaki. In particular, we prove that Serre's conjecture II for characteristic $0$ fields implies Serre's conjecture II for positive characteristic fields.
item.dc:creator: Diego Izquierdo, Giancarlo Lucchini Arteche

item.title: The local solubility for homogeneous polynomials with random coefficients over thin sets
item.description:
arXiv:2308.13685v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Let $d$ and $n$ be natural numbers greater or equal to $2$. Let $\langle  oldsymbol{a}, 
u_{d,n}( oldsymbol{x})angle\in \mathbb{Z}[ oldsymbol{x}]$ be a homogeneous polynomial in $n$ variables of degree $d$ with integer coefficients $ oldsymbol{a}$, where $\langle\cdot,\cdotangle$ denotes the inner product, and $
u_{d,n}: \mathbb{R}^nightarrow \mathbb{R}^N$ denotes the Veronese embedding with $N= inom{n+d-1}{d}$. Consider a variety $V_{ oldsymbol{a}}$ in $\mathbb{P}^{n-1}$, defined by $\langle  oldsymbol{a}, 
u_{d,n}( oldsymbol{x})angle=0.$ In this paper, we examine a set of these varieties defined by $$\mathbb{V}^{P}_{d,n}(A)=\{ V_{ oldsymbol{a}}\subset \mathbb{P}^{n-1}|\ P( oldsymbol{a})=0,\ \| oldsymbol{a}\|_{\infty}\leq A\},$$ where $P\in \mathbb{Z}[ oldsymbol{x}]$ is a non-singular form in $N$ variables of degree $k$ with $2 \le k\leq C({n,d})$ for some constant $C({n,d})$ depending at most on $n$ and $d$. Suppose that $P( oldsymbol{a})=0$ has a nontrivial integer solution. We confirm that the proportion of varieties $V_{ oldsymbol{a}}$ in $\mathbb{V}^{P}_{d,n}(A)$, which are everywhere locally soluble, converges to a constant $c_P$ as $Aightarrow \infty.$ In particular, if there exists $ oldsymbol{b}\in \mathbb{Z}^N$ such that $P( oldsymbol{b})=0$ and the variety $V_{ oldsymbol{b}}$ in $\mathbb{P}^{n-1}$ admits a smooth $\mathbb{Q}$-rational point, the constant $c_P$ is positive.
item.dc:creator: Heejong Lee, Seungsu Lee, Kiseok Yeon

item.title: On the properties of alternating invariant functions
item.description: arXiv:2505.10985v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Functions satisfying the functional equation \begin{align*} \sum_{r=0}^{n-1} (-1)^r f(x+ry, ny) = f(x,y), \quad \text{for any positive odd integer $n$}, \end{align*} are named the alternating invariant functions. Examples of such functions include Euler polynomials, alternating Hurwitz zeta functions and their associated Gamma functions. In this paper, we systematically investigate the fundamental properties of alternating invariant functions. We prove that the set of such functions is closed under translation, reflection, and differentiation. In addition, we define a convolution operation on alternating invariant functions and derive explicit convolution formulas for Euler polynomials and alternating Hurwitz zeta functions, respectively. Furthermore, using distributional relations, we construct new examples of alternating invariant functions, including suitable combinations of trigonometric, exponential, and logarithmic functions, among others.
item.dc:creator: Haiqing Zhu, Su Hu, Min-Soo Kim

item.title: Modular resolutions by polyseries
item.description: arXiv:2507.04231v5 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We study the modular resolution method using a new tool called a polyserie, introduced by Wildberger N.J. \& Rubine D. in their recent article \cite{wildberger2025hyper}. In the present article we try to prove an equivalence theorem of the existence and the uniqueness of the solution of the equation of the form:\\ $H_{t}^{2}\left(x\right) -H_{t}\left( x\right) +t\equiv 0\ \ \left( \mathrm{mod}\text{ }t^{n}\right) $, by using the same recurrence formula introduced in \cite{wildberger2025hyper} between the Catalan sequence terms: $C_{n+1}=\sum_{k=0}^{n}C_{k}C_{n-k}$. We introduce Wildberger's polynumber sequences, binomial Chu-Vandermonde identity, truncated polyseries and finally modular resolution as application.
item.dc:creator: Mahdi-Tahar Brahimi

item.title: Weight-Shifting Operators of Hypergeometric Type for Maass Forms
item.description: arXiv:2508.18310v5 Announce Type: replace Abstract: This paper constructs a weight-shifting integral operator, U_{k,t}, that maps the space of weight-k Maass forms to the space of weight-t functions for the full modular group SL(2,Z). The operator is defined via an integral transform whose kernel is the product of a covariant factor and a modular invariant function, F. The central hypothesis is that the kernel itself must be an eigenfunction of the weight-t hyperbolic Laplacian. We show this spectral condition reduces the determination of F to a Papperitz-Riemann equation, which is then transformed into the standard Gauss Hypergeometric Differential Equation. We provide an explicit determination of the hypergeometric parameters in terms of the initial automorphic data and rigorously establish the operator's region of absolute convergence. The automorphy of the transformed function is proven. In contrast, other key properties such as smoothness and the intertwining condition are supported by conditional arguments that rely on analytical assumptions deferred to future work. Finally, the emergence of the hypergeometric structure suggests a potential connection to the theory of hypergeometric motives, a perspective illustrated by the recovery of the periods of the Legendre family of elliptic curves in a specific case.
item.dc:creator: Seung Ju Lee

item.title: On Euclidean Algorithms for oriented linear Grassmanians
item.description: arXiv:2509.01733v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this paper we study Euclidean algorithms and the corresponding continued fractions for oriented linear Grassmanians $G(k,n)$. We propose two algorithms: Maximal Element Elimination algorithm and Minimal Element Elimination algorithm. The first algorithm reduces the absolute maximal value of the Pl\"ucker coordinates; the algorithm works only in $G(2,n)$. The second algorithm eliminates the Pl\"ucker coordinate with the smallest absolute values, while all other coordinates may increase; the algorithm works for arbitrary $G(2,n)$. We discuss basic features of these algorithms and formulate several natural open questions for further studies.
item.dc:creator: Maxim Arnold, Oleg Karpenkov

item.title: Logarithmic derivatives of L-functions and small prime quadratic nonresidues
item.description: arXiv:2509.03157v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Let $\chi$ be a real non-principal character modulo a prime $q$ and $L(s,\chi)$ be the corresponding $L$-function. We prove that for any real number $s\geq 1$ there holds $$ -\frac{L'(s,\chi )}{L(s,\chi)}\leq c \log q,$$ where $c$ can be taken arbitrarily close to $1/4$ if we assume $q$ is sufficiently large depending upon it. As a consequence, for all large $q$, there are at least $q^{3/50}$ primes $p$ smaller than $q$ such that $\chi(p)=-1$.
item.dc:creator: Genheng Zhao

item.title: Local points on twists of $X(p)$
item.description: arXiv:2509.04294v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Let $E/\mathbb{Q}$ be an elliptic curve and $p \geq 3$ a prime. The modular curve $X_E^-(p)$ parametrizes elliptic curves with $p$-torsion modules anti-symplectically isomorphic to $E[p]$. For each $\ell \neq p$, we give conditions, in terms of the type of reduction of $E$ at $\ell$ and standard invariants associated to $E/\mathbb{Q}_\ell$, for $X_E^-(p)(\mathbb{Q}_\ell)$ to be non-empty. Moreover, our conditions completely classify when $X_E^-(p)(\mathbb{Q}_\ell) \neq \emptyset$ except in a special case of good reduction; our main result includes $\ell = p$ when $E$ is semistable at $p$. As an application, we classify CM curves $E/\mathbb{Q}$ where the modular curve $X_E^-(p)$ is a counterexample to the Hasse principle for infinitely many $p$. Assuming the Frey--Mazur conjecture, we prove that for at least $60\%$ of rational elliptic curves $E$, the modular curve $X_E^-(p)$ is a counterexample to the Hasse principle for at least $50\%$ of primes $p$. Additionally, we simplify several local symplectic criteria in the work of the first author and Alain Kraus.
item.dc:creator: Nuno Freitas, Diana Mocanu

item.title: Intersection patterns, incidence theorems, and distance problems
item.description: arXiv:2304.08004v5 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Let $A$ and $B$ be sets in a finite vector space. In this paper, we study the magnitude of the set $A\cap f(B)$, where $f$ runs through a set of transformations. More precisely, we will focus on the cases that the set of transformations is given by orthogonal matrices or orthogonal projections. One of the most important contributions of this paper is to show that if $A, B\subset \mathbb{F}_q^d$ satisfy some natural conditions, then, for almost every $g\in O(d)$, there are at least $\gg q^d$ elements $z\in \mathbb{F}_q^d$ such that \[|A\cap (g(B)+z)| \sim \frac{|A||B|}{q^d}.\] This implies that $|A-gB|\gg q^d$ for almost every $g\in O(d)$. In the flavor of expanding functions, with $|A|\le |B|$, we also show that the image $A-gB$ grows exponentially. In two dimensions, the result simply says that if $|A|=q^x$ and $|B|=q^y$, as long as $0<x\le y<2$, then for almost every $g\in O(2)$, we can always find $\epsilon=\epsilon(x, y)>0$ such that $|A-gB|\gg |B|^{1+\epsilon}$. To prove these results, we need to develop new and robust incidence bounds between points and rigid motions by using a number of techniques including algebraic methods and discrete Fourier analysis. Our results are essentially sharp in odd dimensions. In the prime field plane, we further employ recent $L^2$ distance bounds and point-line/plane incidence machinery to derive improvements. Notable applications include a strong prime field analogue of a question of Mattila related to the Falconer distance problem, the Rotational Erd\H{o}s-Falconer distance problem, and a quadratic expansion law. Taken together, the results in this paper present a robust two-way link between intersection phenomena and distance problems over finite fields, with dimension-uniform consequences and sharpness in several ranges.
item.dc:creator: Thang Pham, Semin Yoo

item.title: Equations involving the modular $j$-function and its derivatives
item.description: arXiv:2312.09974v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We show that for any polynomial $F(X,Y_0,Y_1,Y_2) \in \mathbb{C}[X, Y_0, Y_1, Y_2]$, the equation $F(z,j(z),j'(z),j''(z))=0$ has a Zariski dense set of solutions in the hypersurface $F(X,Y_0,Y_1,Y_2)=0$, unless $F$ is in $\mathbb{C}[X]$ or it is divisible by $Y_0$, $Y_0-1728$, or $Y_1$. Our methods establish criteria for finding solutions to more general equations involving periodic functions. Furthermore, they produce a qualitative description of the distribution of these solutions.
item.dc:creator: Vahagn Aslanyan, Sebastian Eterovi\'c, Vincenzo Mantova

item.title: Unitary Shimura varieties at ramified primes and arithmetic transfer
item.description: arXiv:2504.17484v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We consider unitary Shimura varieties at places where the totally real field ramifies over $\mbQ$. Our first result constructs comparison isomorphisms between absolute and relative local models in this context, which relies on a reformulation of the Eisenstein condition of Rapoport--Zink and Rapoport--Smithling--Zhang. Related to that, we also provide a moduli description for the integral models of RSZ unitary Shimura varieties in new cases. Our second result lifts the comparison of local models to categories of $p$-divisible groups and, as a corollary, to various kinds of Rapoport--Zink spaces. Our third result is a proof of the arithmetic transfer conjecture of the third author in full generality. Using our statements about Rapoport--Zink spaces, we extend the previous proof from the unramified case to that of all $p$-adic local fields ($p$ odd).
item.dc:creator: Yu Luo, Andreas Mihatsch, Zhiyu Zhang

item.title: Global $GL_2$ Hecke-Baxter operator
item.description: arXiv:2507.09979v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We construct a global Hecke-Baxter operator for integrable systems of arithmetic type associated with the group $GL_2$. This is an element of a global Hecke algebra associated with the double coset space $GL_2(\mathbb{Z})\backslash GL_2(\mathbb{R})/O_2$. Eigenvalues of the global Hecke-Baxter operator acting on the $GL_2$-Eisenstein series are given by the corresponding global $L$-factors. This construction generalizes our previous construction of the Hecke-Baxter operators over local completions $\mathbb{R}$ and $\mathbb{Q}_p$ of the number field $\mathbb{Q}$. Presumably, zeroes of the corresponding global $L$-factors should be subjected to an arithmetic version of the Bethe ansatz equations.
item.dc:creator: Anton A. Gerasimov, Dmitry R. Lebedev, Sergey V. Oblezin
